text: Pursuant to section five hundred twenty-one of the judiciary law, where a grand jury has been, or will hereafter be, empaneled to serve at an extraordinary and trial term of the supreme court of this state in any county within the city of New York, and where the term of such a grand jury continues for a period longer than thirty days from the date when such grand jury was empaneled and sworn, the sum of twelve dollars shall be allowed to each member of such grand jury for each day's necessary attendance as a grand juror from and after the expiration of such thirty-day period and until such grand jury shall have been discharged by the court.

heading.catch_text: Fees to grand jurors of extraordinary terms.
